title: Ex-Boeing Pilot Complained of Management Pressure on MAX, Former Colleagues Say
text:
Mark Forkner, a former senior Boeing Co. pilot who was publicly vaulted into the company’s 737 MAX crisis, complained years ago that he felt pressure from management to ensure the series of jets wouldn’t require expensive pilot training, according to former colleagues.

Mr. Forkner, who at the time was the chief technical pilot for the MAX and who is a focus of a federal probe of the jet’s development, became well-known Friday when internal messages that Boeing turned over to congressional investigators suggested he might...
description: Mark Forkner, a former Boeing pilot, complained years ago he felt pressure from management to ensure 737 MAX jets wouldn’t require expensive pilot training.
